title: Commit initial copy of members list
Update meta org
body:
This updates the meta org as follows:
- Pull a copy of the OWNERS_ALIASES from k/community
- Updates membership as of 7/16
- Adds a folder of team members for sig-contributor-experience. Example of what it would look like to have sig-responsible teams.

title: Add issue templates
body: This adds issue templates to allow users to submit common kinds of requests.

title: Organization domain verification
body:
https://blog.github.com/changelog/2018-08-07-domain-verification/
https://help.github.com/articles/verifying-your-organization-s-domain/
https://github.com/organizations/kubernetes/settings/domains

I'd like to verify our domains with GitHub. The TL;DR is you create a TXT record, and then you get a verified badge. We should do this for all active orgs.

cc: @kubernetes/owners @thockin @ixdy

title: Update org configurations - Aug 8, 2018
body:
- Update OWNERS files
- Add org configs for all active orgs
- Dump current org membership for all active orgs.

title: Steering committee acls on the org.
body: Steering committee members should have admin acls on the org to move repos and add members.

title: Administration acls on sig sponsored sub-project repos.
body:
### Organization or repository
e.g. kubernetes-sigs/*

### Users effected
sig-leads

### Describe the issue
The sigs leads/chairs who are responsible for a given sub-project needs team policies that enable maintainer level acls on those repos and teams.  

For examples: 
In https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/cluster-api-provider-aws I do not have permissions to manage the teams and permissions.

title: Script to apply declared config
body:
Plus other initial infrastructure

/assign @spiffxp @cblecker 

Primarily supporting the following:
```shell
bazel test //config:all  # Test all the various config/kubernetes-foo orgs
bazel run //admin:update # Run peribolos on all the files
```

Docs at https://github.com/fejta/org/blob/infra/admin/README.md

title: Remove kubernetes/common
body:
### Repository to archive
[kubernetes/common](https://github.com/kubernetes/common)

### Repository and/or sig subproject owners that are approving this archival
@timothysc @bgrant0607 @monopole 

### When should this be done
Anytime

### Additional context for request
I'm advocating for repo removal rather than repo archival because there's nothing in the repo in question except for some boilerplate. 

 I started a thread on k8s-steering because the repo seemed ownerless (ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/issues/2464), and opened an issue asking whether the repo was necessary (ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/common/issues/8)

Consensus is that it's unneeded

title: Generate list of contributions for org membership
body:
We ask for a list of contributions in the org membership template. The list includes PRs reviewed, authored or issues created (but not limited to it). It would be nice to automate and generate this list.

There was a discussion related to this before: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/issues/874. Creating an issue here instead because having the script in this repo would be make more sense IMO.

PS: I had written something quick for this a long time back - https://github.com/nikhita/github-contrib.

/cc @cblecker @fejta @spiffxp @justaugustus 
/kind feature

title: ISSUE_TEMPLATE/membership: fix markdown rendering
body:
In the current issue template for membership, the last few points are not displayed in "List of contributions": https://github.com/kubernetes/org/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/membership.md#list-of-contributions-to-the-kubernetes-project. I think it's because the points are listed in angle brackets (`<Issues responded to>`), which markdown treats as html.

/assign cblecker

title: Vendor ability to read prow configs
body:
First commit is some `.gitignore` entries

Second commit is `hack/update-deps.sh` (see the [test-infra](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/blob/master/hack/update-deps.sh) version of this script) on #8.

Once we get this and `0c141977c30f2b684db1a1fdd8e5a1f320badea9` in we can add presubmits to validate all the `hack/verify-*` scripts pass before merge (let me know if you want me to add the hack scripts into this PR or the next one).

/assign @calebamiles @spiffxp @cblecker

title: Add some bazel and hack rules
body:
Once these are checked in I can add presubmit jobs for this repo


/assign @calebamiles @spiffxp @cblecker

title: Add brendandburns to kubernetes-clients github org
Create new `https://github.com/kubernetes/csi-api` repo
body:
Please create 1 new repo

### Requested name for new repository
https://github.com/kubernetes/csi-api

### Which Organization should it reside
e.g. kubernetes-sigs

### Who should be provided access to this repository
Please make https://github.com/saad-ali owner

### Approvals
Please include links to the approvals (meeting minutes, e-mail thread, etc)
https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kubernetes-sig-storage-wg-csi/x5CchIP9qiI/00Trm4g1CwAJ

### Additional context for request
Any additional information or context to describe the request.

This will be used to house the new `CSIDriver` CRD object proposed in https://github.com/kubernetes/community/pull/2514

Following the existing pattern of https://github.com/kubernetes/api and https://github.com/kubernetes/client-go, CSI types will be defined in "k8s.io/kubernetes/staging/...". The generated API and client will be published, upon merge, to https://github.com/kubernetes/csi-api


/assign @cblecker @spiffxp 
CC @kubernetes/owners 

*Edit:* Modified request to drop 2nd repo `csi-client-go` (will publish generated client and API to `csi-api`).

title: REQUEST: Creation of KEP 14 repos
body:
To implement [KEP 14](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/keps/sig-cluster-lifecycle/0014-20180707-componentconfig-api-types-to-staging.md), we need a couple of repos.

### New Repo
- ~~cloud-controller-manager~~
- kube-controller-manager
- kube-scheduler
- kubelet
- kube-proxy

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes

Note that these are "staging repositories", i.e. they are published by the https://github.com/kubernetes/publishing-bot and therefore must be in the `kubernetes` org.

### Who should be provided access to this repository

We need **admin access for the `stage-bots` team**, compare:

![bildschirmfoto 2018-09-03 um 13 54 46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/730123/45020493-70f73200-b02f-11e8-9a2e-797a1e9a2814.png)

We need branch settings like:

![bildschirmfoto 2018-09-03 um 13 55 26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/730123/45020616-c3d0e980-b02f-11e8-8e00-95e8e8f95e37.png)

### Approvals

KEP 14: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/keps/sig-cluster-lifecycle/0014-20180707-componentconfig-api-types-to-staging.md

### Additional context for request

The staging repositories have been created [in the staging/ directory of the k/k repo](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/tree/master/staging/src/k8s.io), all approved by top-level approvers @jbeda and @thockin.

/cc @luxas @stewart-yu

kubernetes

title: kubernetes-csi lacks org-level CNCF CLA webhook
body:
### Organization or repository
kuberentes-csi

### Name of integration
https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/github-management/setting-up-cla-check.md

### Link to integration website
https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/CLA.md

### Describe what is attempting to be accomplished
Now that the kubernetes-csi repos have branch protection applied, it's become clear that a few of them aren't getting the cla/linuxfoundation check.  Turns out this check has been enabled as webhooks on a per-repo basis rather than at the org level.  We should go through and remove the per-repo hooks, and setup the org-wide hook.

### Additional context for request
Examples where the check isn't firing:
- https://github.com/kubernetes-csi/external-snapshotter/pull/18
- https://github.com/kubernetes-csi/external-snapshotter/pull/24
- https://github.com/kubernetes-csi/kubernetes-csi.github.io/pull/4

I checked our other orgs, this appears to be the only one missing it

title: Repo creation request: kubernetes-sigs repo for moving out kubernetes/test-infra/kind
body:
### New Repo, or migrate existing
New Repo (?) (Migrating [a directory](https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/tree/master/kind) out of https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra)

### Requested name for new repository
`kind` would be ideal, it's the tool's name now, seems to not be in use elsewhere and is a good CLI / install path.

kind == Kubernetes IN Docker (see blow)

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs -- this is a sig-testing project

### Who should be provided access to this repository
e.g (at)example_user should have write access

- @bentheelder - I'd like at least write access (admin? owner? whatever is acceptable), I initially authored and currently maintain / actively develop  this project
- @munnerz - should also have identical access to @bentheelder (munnerz is a co-`approver` and key contributor)
- @krzyzacy and @amwat - should at least be collaborators in the kubernetes-sigs org, they are test-infra maintainers and `kind` `reviewer`s currently

### Approvals
This is a SIG repository, I requested a vote by email and in the SIG weekly meeting for sig-testing:

- Three SIG-Testing leads voted in favor of this here: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/kubernetes-sig-testing/DcvxFVaGqGo
- This was additionally discussed in the sig-testing meeting today with support. I'll add a link once the video is available. EDIT: here it is https://youtu.be/av3eFyyFryA


### Additional context for request
Per the sig discussion, we've incubated this in test-infra under sig-testing, but we'd like to move it out (and in the future other parts of test-infra), and set up CI for it there without bogging down PRs to the test-infra config and other tools etc. We also need a way to version it back to `kubetest` which is in test-infra, so moving it out seems like the way to solve this.

title: New repo for kubernetes-incubator/external-storage/lib
body:
### New Repo, or migrate existing
new repository

### Requested name for new repository
sig-storage-external-provisioner-lib

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### Who should be provided access to this repository
@wongma7
@jsafrane 
@childsb

### Approvals
Need sig-storage approval from: @childsb and @saad-ali 
See "External Storage - Moving Project Out" in https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AoemMxRcRDhc3gpChGk-UwCiVsk7Q7E_yKeIKP-7jL4/edit?ts=5ad14c06#heading=h.6ufuho4zfqau

### Additional context for request
Currently, kubernetes-incubator/external-storage houses both a small library under /lib for writing external provisioners and a number of "community-maintained" provisioners which depend on the library. We want to separate the library and the provisioners.

It can be difficult for users/dependers of the library to vendor it and for library maintainers to update it (as frequently as versions of kubernetes are released) due to the need to untangle golang dependency webs if/when conflicts arise.

cc @verult

title: Create repositories for aws-ebs-csi-driver as a SIG AWS subproject
body:
### New Repo, or migrate existing
migrate repository

### Requested name for new repository
aws-ebs-csi-driver

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### Who should be provided access to this repository
@d-nishi should have write access
@leakingtapan should have write access
@bertinatto should have write access
@gnufied should have write access
@jsafrane should have write access

### Approvals
1. SIG-AWS Group reached consensus to create the repo on April 20th 2018 – please refer to the minutes on Aug 24th: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-i0xQidlXnFEP9fXHWkBxqySkXwJnrGJP9OGyP2_P14/edit#
2. Kubernetes code of conduct is adopted: https://github.com/d-nishi/aws-ebs-csi-driver/blob/master/code-of-conduct.md
3. The repo uses Apache License v2: https://github.com/d-nishi/aws-ebs-csi-driver/blob/master/LICENSE 
4. CNCF CLA bot is enabled as a webhook on the repo.
5. All contributors have signed the CNCF individual or corporate CLA
6. The topic for the sponsoring SIG is added as k8s-sig-aws on the repository: https://github.com/d-nishi/aws-ebs-csi-driver/
7. Fossabadge was added for a couple of 3rd party dependencies: https://github.com/d-nishi/aws-ebs-csi-driver/pull/19
- There are some dependency check failures for which this PR is open - https://github.com/kubernetes/sig-release/issues/223 -- I will work with @nikitha and @justaugustus to close this in the future.
- The scan failure is not linked to any 3rd party dependency at the 1st level of this repo. Double checked and confirmed with @caniszczyk 

TODO:
- Update [sigs.yaml](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/sigs.yaml) file after repo transfer is complete.
- Add LinuxFoundation as a collaborator after repo transfer is complete as the repo is in my personal github account.

title: Rename k/features to k/enhancements
body:
### New Repo, or migrate existing
`k/features`

### Requested name for new repository
`k/enhancements`

### Which Organization should it reside
`kubernetes`

### Who should be provided access to this repository
At the offset, access will remain the same

### Approvals
Please detail out the approval process for the new repo
Requirements are listed here: https://git.k8s.io/community/github-management/kubernetes-repositories.md
If this is a core repository, then sig-architecture must approve
If this is a SIG repository, then the SIG Technical Leads must approve
Please include links to the approvals (meeting minutes, e-mail thread, etc)

### Additional context for request
Any additional information or context to describe the request.

Work item for https://github.com/kubernetes/features/issues/617

/kind feature
/sig pm
/milestone v1.13
/assign

body:
### Organization or repository
kubernetes/*

### Describe the issue
Due to a 2FA snarfu I've temporarily (for 6 months) lost access to my quinton-hoole github account.  So I'm now quinton-hoole-2.  @spiffxp could I ask you to please grant quinton-hoole-2 the same github permissions as quinton-hoole has, across all repos in the kubernetes/* orgs?  

Best leave quinton-hoole as is, because I'll hopefully switch back to that account in 6 months, once the github grace period has expired.  Weird, I know, but that's how it works.  

Many thanks in advance...

Quinton

title: Create https://github.com/kubernetes-csi/kubernetes-csi-migration-library
body:
### New Repo, or migrate existing
Please create a new repo

### Requested name for new repository
https://github.com/kubernetes-csi/kubernetes-csi-migration-library

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-csi

### Who should be provided access to this repository
Please make:
https://github.com/davidz627
https://github.com/saad-ali
owners

### Approvals
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/kubernetes-sig-storage-wg-csi/YHHGqTkLets
Approved by sig-lead Saad Ali

### Additional context for request

I am proposing to create a new repository in the "kubernetes-csi" github organization to house the translation library for in-tree to CSI Migration for Kubernetes.
The background and design for this can be found here: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/design-proposals/storage/csi-migration.md
This library will house the logic for converting between CSI Source and each In-tree Source and vice-versa.

title: Archive localization repositories and teams
body:
### Repository to archive

The following localization repositories:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-ja
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-ko
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-zh

And their associated teams:

```
 @kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-ja-admins
 @kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-ja-maintainers
 @kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-ko-admins
 @kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-ko-maintainers
 @kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-zh-admins
 @kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-zh-maintainers
 @kubernetes/kubernetes-docs-zh-reviewers
```

These are replaced with localization-specific workflows and teams in `k/website`.

See https://github.com/kubernetes/website/pull/10485 for context.

### Repository and/or sig subproject owners that are approving this archival

@zacharysarah, Chair of [SIG Docs](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/tree/master/sig-docs)

### When should this be done

After https://github.com/kubernetes/website/pull/10485 merges (scheduled Friday, October 11)

### Additional context for request

From the description of https://github.com/kubernetes/website/pull/10485:

> The combination of native multilingual support and automated language labeling allows SIG Docs to consolidate l10n workflows in a single repository: `k/website`. This strategy scales appropriately with increasing numbers of localizations.

/sig docs
/assign @cblecker 

/cc @cstoku # kubernetes-docs-ja 
/cc @gochist # kubernetes-docs-ko
/cc @hanjiayao # kubernetes-docs-zh
/cc @kubernetes/sig-docs-maintainers

title: Enable FOSSA license scanning across all Kubernetes orgs
body:
### Organization or repository
All k8s orgs

### Name of integration
FOSSA

### Link to integration website
- https://fossa.io/
- https://github.com/fossas/fossa-docs/blob/master/src/md/getting-started/repository-permissions.md

### Describe what is attempting to be accomplished
As a project, we'd like to be able to scan software licenses with some framework and it seems the general consensus has been to use FOSSA.
There are multiple tracking issues and threads to catch up on, so I'll point there instead:
- Open `k/steering` issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/steering/issues/57
- Umbrella `k/sig-release` tracking: https://github.com/kubernetes/sig-release/issues/223
- Older `k/steering` issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/steering/issues/21

### Additional context for request
N/A

<!-- DO NOT EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->
/area github-integration
/assign
/cc @kubernetes/owners @nikhita @dims @swinslow

requirements from new or migrated repos

title: Add --merge-teams and --ignore-teams flags to the merge binary
body:
/assign @cblecker @spiffxp 

This will allow us to delegate team membership to sigs.

Try out with `bazel run //cmd/merge -- --org-part=kubernetes=$PWD/config/kubernetes/org.yaml --merge-teams`

When we want to turn this on switch `--ignore-teams` to `--merge-teams` in `//config:gen-config.yaml`

title: Please create kubernetes/klog (for forking glog)
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
Import https://github.com/dims/klog into kubernetes org

### Requested name for new repository
klog

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
@dims  @thockin

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
@tallclair @justinsb, @erictune @lavalamp 

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
@tallclair  @justinsb, @erictune @lavalamp @dims @thockin

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
@dims @thockin

### What should the repo description be
`Leveled execution logs for Go (fork of https://github.com/golang/glog)`

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
sig-architecture

### Approvals
Please prove you have followed the appropriate approval process for this new
repo by including links to the relevant approvals (meeting minutes, e-mail
thread, etc.)
Discussion in sig-arch on Oct 25, 2018 ( http://bit.ly/sig-architecture )

Authoritative requirements are here: https://git.k8s.io/community/github-management/kubernetes-repositories.md

tl;dr (but really you should read the linked doc, this may be stale)
- If this is a core repository, then sig-architecture must approve
- If this is a SIG repository, then this must follow the procedure spelled out
  in that SIG's charter

### Additional context for request
Any additional information or context to describe the request.

<!-- DO NOT EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->
/area github-repo

- timothysc

- xmudrii

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
OWNERS file defined here: https://github.com/kubermatic/cluster-api-provider-digitalocean/blob/master/OWNERS_ALIASES

### What should the repo description be
The DigitalOcean provider implementation of the Cluster Management API

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
This is a subproject for SIG-Cluster-Lifecycle and Cluster-API

### Approvals
1. SIG-Cluster-Lifecycle discussed and approved upstreaming this Cluster-API provider on the meeting held on 10/23. [Meeting notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1deJYPIF4LmhGjDVaqrswErIrV7mtwJgovtLnPCDxP7U/edit#heading=h.u0dmn4xhr8u1) and [Recording (discussion about this starts at 21:22)](https://youtu.be/ECKy4Ql9A74?t=1282)
1. [SIG-Cluster-Lifecycle mailing post for lazy consensus](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kubernetes-sig-cluster-lifecycle/rvCtQRuE4J4/aAfXzywvBAAJ). There is also approval by SIG leads in this thread.
1. The repository uses Apache License v2: https://github.com/kubermatic/cluster-api-provider-digitalocean/blob/master/LICENSE
1. Kubernetes Community Code of Conduct is adopted: https://github.com/kubermatic/cluster-api-provider-digitalocean/blob/master/code-of-conduct.md
1. [All contributors listed on GitHub](https://github.com/kubermatic/cluster-api-provider-digitalocean/graphs/contributors) are active contributors to Kubernetes project, so they have CNCF CLA signed.
1. @nikhita has done Dependency License checks and the results are available on [the mailing list post](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kubernetes-sig-cluster-lifecycle/rvCtQRuE4J4/i0nanNk_BwAJ).

Authoritative requirements are here: https://git.k8s.io/community/github-management/kubernetes-repositories.md

### Additional context for request
Any additional information or context to describe the request.

1. Update [sigs.yaml](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/sigs.yaml) once the repository is transferred.

title: Migrate Kubespray to kubernetes-sigs
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
As discussed with sig-cluster-lifecycle in the  [28th Sept meeting](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1deJYPIF4LmhGjDVaqrswErIrV7mtwJgovtLnPCDxP7U/edit#heading=h.mhdh6zeg1w9d) we'd like to migrate https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/kubespray to the https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs org.

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
ant31, mattymo

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
ant31, mattymo, riverzhang, chadswen, atoms, mirwan, woopstar


### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
subproject for sig-cluster-lifecycle
note: Kubespray is already listed in the sigs.yaml

### Approvals

- [x] @timothysc 
- [x] @justinsb 

### Additional context for request

Kubespray is today one of the most active projects by many metrics in the kubernetes/* orgs ([k8s.devstats.cncf.io](https://k8s.devstats.cncf.io/d/49/github-stats-by-repository?orgId=1&var-stat=commits&from=now-90d&to=now)), it has more 300+ contributors and many users. 
As the incubator org is deprecated and the project is still very active, the sig cluster-lifecycle agreed to host it in kubernetes-sigs. 

<!-- DO NOT EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->
/area github-repo

title: Please create kubernetes-sigs/yaml (for forking https://github.com/ghodss/yaml/)
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
Import https://github.com/ghodss/yaml/ into kubernetes-sigs org

### Requested name for new repository
`yaml`

### Which Organization should it reside
`kubernetes-sigs`

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
@lavalamp @deads2k @liggitt @dims 

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
@lavalamp @deads2k @liggitt @dims 

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
same as https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubernetes/apimachinery/master/OWNERS

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
same as https://github.com/kubernetes/apimachinery/blob/master/SECURITY_CONTACTS

### What should the repo description be
A better way to marshal and unmarshal YAML in Golang (fork of https://github.com/ghodss/yaml/)

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
sig-api-machinery `universal-machinery` subproject

### Approvals
Please prove you have followed the appropriate approval process for this new
repo by including links to the relevant approvals (meeting minutes, e-mail
thread, etc.)

Please see email thread : https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kubernetes-sig-api-machinery/mzSP44WMJl4/m1p6U4qVBwAJ

Authoritative requirements are here: https://git.k8s.io/community/github-management/kubernetes-repositories.md

tl;dr (but really you should read the linked doc, this may be stale)
- If this is a core repository, then sig-architecture must approve
- If this is a SIG repository, then this must follow the procedure spelled out
  in that SIG's charter

### Additional context for request
Any additional information or context to describe the request.

title: New repo: website-metadata
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing

New repository

### Requested name for new repository

website-metadata

### Which Organization should it reside

kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access

@Bradamant3 
@chenopis 
@zacharysarah 

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access

TBD—SIG Docs chairs will work with localization team leads to set write permissions.

This PR may require a request for several new members in kubernetes-sigs.

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS

```md
- bradamant3 
- chenopis 
- zacharysarah 
```

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS

```md
- bradamant3 
- chenopis 
- zacharysarah 
```

### What should the repo description be

```md
Metadata for Kubernetes docs translation
```

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml

SIG: [Docs](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/sigs.yaml#L1017)

Subproject: [website](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/sigs.yaml#L1069)

### Approvals

SIG Docs chairs (@Bradamant3, @chenopis) must `:+1:` this issue to proceed.

- [x] @Bradamant3 
- [x] @chenopis 
- [x] @zacharysarah 

### Additional context for request

This request arises directly from the localization sprint at KubeCon/CloudNativeCon Shanghai 2018.

Specifically, this repo is to implement the logic described in https://github.com/servicemesher/istio-official-translation (content in Chinese) to track metadata in [k/website](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/) and help localization teams track diffs in content.

/cc @hanjiayao @markthink @fleeto 
/sig docs

<!-- DO NOT EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->
/area github-repo

title: Create windows-testing repo
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
Migrate existing from https://github.com/e2e-win/k8s_images

### Requested name for new repository
kubernetes-sigs/windows-testing

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
@michmike, @patricklang, @Adelina-t

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
@michmike, @patricklang, @Adelina-t, @bclau

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
@michmike, @patricklang, @Adelina-t

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
@michmike, @patricklang, @Adelina-t

### What should the repo description be
Test infrastructure and containers for testing Windows Kubernetes nodes

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
sig-windows

### Approvals

No objections in 11/20 SIG meeting, so email thread sent:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/kubernetes-sig-windows/lxK6CuPhv34
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/kubernetes-sig-testing/MN8DEiM95Z4

No objections in threads or 11/27 SIG-Windows meeting, so we have lazy consensus.

### Additional context for request
Testing Windows nodes needs extra container images to be built that are not currently built from kubernetes/kubernetes or kubernetes/test-infra.

This repo will hold the code that's built by SIG-Windows until we can find a way to merge it into the main project, or eliminate the need for them.

/sig windows

/area github-repo

title: New Repo: kubebuilder-maestro
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
new repository

### Requested name for new repository
maestro

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
@kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder-admins

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
@kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder-admins, @gerred 

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
@kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder-admins, @gerred

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
@kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder-admins, gerred

### What should the repo description be
A universal operator that generates and runs operators based on a standard data format.

Associated proposal: https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder/pull/489

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
This is part of the kubebuilder subproject for SIG API Machinery.

### Approvals
kubebuilder subproject core maintainers should approve this repo:

- [x] pwittrock
- [x] droot
- [x] DirectXMan12

### Additional context for request
While Kubebuilder provides an abstraction around the plumbing for building operators, there is still a lot of work to implement operators in code. To combat this problem, Mesosphere built an SDK for DC/OS, as well as a package data format, that handles a lot of the common high level tasks in running stateful workloads and provides lifecycle hooks. The purpose of Maestro is to take this work and enable the same standard packaging format and lifecycle hooks to be applied to Kubernetes operators.

https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder/pull/489

/cc @gerred @pwittrock @DirectXMan12

<!-- DO NOT EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->
/area github-repo

piosz, brancz, dashpole

### What should the repo description be
a mutating admission controller which enables experimental tracing of kubernetes object lifecycle

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
This is a new subproject for sig-instrumentation called mutating-trace-admission-controller

### Approvals
[Meeting notes from 2018-11-29](https://docs.google.com/document/d/17emKiwJeqfrCsv0NZ2FtyDbenXGtTNCsDEiLbPa7x7Y) say "house mutating webhook for adding trace to an object in kubernetes-sigs"

[Sig-instrumentation charter](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/sig-instrumentation/charter.md#subproject-creation) specifies that subproject creation is "By SIG Technical Leads"

### Additional context for request
See https://github.com/Monkeyanator/mutating-trace-admission-controller for @Monkeyanator's current work on the mutating admission controller for tracing.

/assign @brancz @piosz 
for explicit approval

<!-- DO NOT EDIT BELOW THIS LINE -->
/area github-repo

### List of contributions to the Kubernetes project

- PRs authored
  - add unit tests for api-service condition methods and also refactor out getAPIServiceConditionByType - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71525
  - increase the liveness probe delay for GCE e2e tests to avoid premature teardown - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71054
  - fix healthz checkerNames test so that it tests against the expected output - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/70753
  - add ability to disable health checks on kube-apiserver for healthz using query-params - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/70676
  - fix lint issues in the apis/abac directory (except latest.go) - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/69596
  - refactor index_test to compress the assertions and make consistent with store_test.go - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/69537
  - Fix a golint error on head (type doesn't need to declared as it will be inferred) - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/69185
  - fix a few typographic errors in test utils file - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/68903

- PRs reviewed
  - Log prometheus metric registration error and fix CRD metric names - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71767
  - Add gauge metric for master of leader election.- https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71731
  - Use prometheus conventions for workqueue metrics - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71300
  - Fix incorrect url in authorization_test.go - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71545
  - aggregator: add APIService unavailability metrics - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71380
  - Fix quota controller discovery deadlock - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71516
  - add a metric that can be used to notice stuck worker threads - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/70884
  - Change APIServer startup message - https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/testing_frameworks/pull/48
  - aggregator: fix available condition transition time - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/71785

- Issues responded to
  - healthz checker test doesn't test what it should - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/70752
  - Add the ability to kube-apiserver's healthz endpoint to disable health checks via query params - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/70591
  - [Failing Test] [sig-cluster-lifecycle] Upgrade and Downgrade jobs are failing - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/70972
  - API server silently ignoring fields should be verbose - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/71623
  - LivenessProbe should start after ReadinessProbe Succeeded if ReadinessProbe is specified - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/27114
  - Use prometheus conventions for workqueue metrics - https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/71165

sig api-machinery

body:
### Repository to archive
`github.com/kubernetes-csi/csi-driver-cinder`

### Repository and/or sig subproject owners that are approving this archival
/sig storage

### When should this be done
Anytime

### Additional context for request

This repo was created as part of https://github.com/kubernetes/org/issues/92.

However, SIG storage ended up never using it because Openstack folks who own and maintain Cinder already have a repo: https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/tree/master/pkg/csi/cinder.

So no need to "archive" `github.com/kubernetes-csi/csi-driver-cinder` -- just delete it.

title: Bump org dependencies
body: Update WORKSPACE and dep dependencies for k8s.io/org. This will bring in some peribolos fixes.

title: Automate the management of github team membership
body:
/kind design
/sig contributor-experience
/area github

I was unable to find an issue to point to for "we intend to one day automate team membership via peribolos" so now I've gone and created one.

I have used peribolos in the past to mass-create some teams for kubernetes-csi repos, but it wasn't a very friendly experience.  I used a file to generate the teams and populate members/maintainers, but I still had to go through and manually assign ACLs to repos.  

Ultimately I think we want to make this a self-service experience akin to test-infra's config/jobs directory, where files are sharded and OWNERS files allow sigs to control their thing.  But I hazily recall we have discussed in the past the idea of iterating with one massive file per org to start with.

There's also the question of whether we want to disallow team maintainers as a role, and instead just use members + OWNERS files here.  Today I can find no documented policy on who is supposed to be a Team Maintainer and what their responsibilities are.

/assign @cblecker @fejta 
as the two who have the most hands on experience and best chance of enumerating what remains to be done here

body:
🙊!

This might actually work.

### Additional context for request
A prototype for the content of the new repo is here: https://github.com/pohly/csi-build-rules/

The less boilerplate files we can have in the repo the better, because the entire repo will be copied into a sub-directory of other kubernetes-csi repos, for example like this: https://github.com/pohly/external-attacher/commits/build-rules

title: Repo Creation: k-sigs/metrics-scraper
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
New Repository

### Requested name for new repository
dashboard-metrics-scraper

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
@jeefy, @maciaszczykm, @floreks, @bryk 

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
@jeefy, @maciaszczykm, @floreks, @bryk 

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
@jeefy, @maciaszczykm, @floreks, @bryk 

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
@jeefy, @maciaszczykm, @floreks, @bryk 

### What should the repo description be
Container to scrape, store, and retrieve a window of time from the Metrics Server.

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
sig-ui

### Approvals
(Under Jan 3rd)
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PwHFvqiShLIq8ZpoXvE3dSUnOv1ts5BTtZ7aATuKd-E/edit#

### Additional context for request
With heapster deprecated, this is a short-term (6-9mo) solution to provide metrics/sparklines to the dashboard by scraping the Metrics API and storing a window of data. The intent is, once this is in place, to build support/integration for other metrics providers (Prometheus to start) and phase this out. Ping me here (or in Slack) with any additional questions. :) Thanks!

This would be useful to fail early if someone who is added as a team maintainer or member is not an org member. See https://github.com/kubernetes/org/pull/346#pullrequestreview-191923294 for an example.

This PR also validates:

- a user is not mentioned as both an org admin and org member
- a user is not mentioned as both a team maintainer and member
- no duplicates exist in the list of team maintainers and members

title: Use go modules instead of dep for dependency management
body:
* Use go 1.11
* Update skylib, rules_go, gazelle repos to match test-infra
* Create `//:go` target, as well as `//:update-minor` and `//:update-patch` targets for updating deps.
* Get `kazel` and `peribolos` from `@io_kubernetes_build` and `@io_k8s_test_infra` repos
* Run `go mod init` to create `k8s.io/org` module
* Make hack/update-deps.sh use `go mod` instead of `dep`
  - Runs `go mod tidy && go mod vendor` to manage vendor dir
  - Runs `//:gazelle -- update-repos --from-file=go.mod` to manage `go_repositories()`

/assign @cblecker

title: Integration of SemaphoreCI to kubernetes/kompose
body:
### Organization or repository
https://github.com/kubernetes/kompose

### Name of integration
SemaphoreCI

### Link to integration website
https://semaphoreci.com/

### Describe what is attempting to be accomplished
Essentially, we've been using SemaphoreCI for the past two years up until last November 2018. I believe when they "upgraded" to SemaphoreCI 2.0 they re-created their GitHub service token and thus SemaphoreCI was removed from our repo (https://github.com/kubernetes/kompose)

I would like to have SemaphoreCI Classic (not 2.0) re-enabled again so we're able to continue to do our integration tests against Kubernetes.

### Additional context for request
The use-case is to run our integration tests. At the moment we're only running unit tests and command-line tests.

Many thanks!

title: Add csi-misc team to tag all developers
body:
For CSI development we need to tag all developers in PRs and issues. IMO, we don't need separate csi-pr-reviews and csi-bugs teams, everybody does everything, `@csi-misc` in any `kubernetes-csi` repo should be enough.

Do we need the same team in `kubernetes/` repos?

/hold
for discussion in sig-storage first.

@chakri-nelluri @davidz627 @gnufied @lpabon @pohly @rootfs @sbezverk @vladimirvivien @xing-yang @saad-ali  @childsb , PTAL. Feel free to suggest other members or remove yourself.

title: netlify integration for kubernetes-sigs/kind
body:
### Organization or repository
e.g. kubernetes-sigs/kind

### Name of integration
netlify

### Link to integration website
https://www.netlify.com/

### Describe what is attempting to be accomplished
We're attempting to set up a sub project documentation site, per SIG-docs netlify + hugo is the recommended toolset for this.

### Additional context for request
I _think_ the netlify "site" will have access by one member, the maintainers of kind (@munnerz and I) have created https://github.com/kind-ci-robot as a possible option to jointly manage this. If we went this route, the robot would also need to join kubernetes-sigs.

cc @jimangel

title: Please add `dims` as admin for k8s.io/utils repo
body:
we have a few PRs in the queue that the cncf bot has logged as bad. the PRs are just moving git commits from one repo to another and the bot is not helpful at all. see details in https://github.com/cncf/foundation/issues/26#issuecomment-456842341

the current work around is to run `/override`, so can you please make me an admin to be able to run that command?

Thanks,
Dims

new repository

kubebuilder-declarative-pattern

kubernetes-sigs

@kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder-admins, @justinsb, @johnsonj

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
@kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder-admins, @justinsb, @johnsonj

@kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder-admins, @justinsb, @johnsonj

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
@kubernetes-sigs/kubebuilder-admins, @justinsb, @johnsonj

A toolkit for building declarative operators with kubebuilder.

title: Milestone maintainers on kubernetes-sigs
body:
### Organization or repository
e.g. kubernetes-sigs/* 

### Users effected
All approvers

### Describe the issue
Currently kubernetes_sigs is a federated set of repositories that spans multiple sigs.  Management of those subprojects is meant to be decentralized and for them to live on their own, possibly with their own lifecycle. 

As of today, there is a need to give approvers the ability to set their own milestones but they can not do that given existing permissions model on milestone maintainers.  

This is not tenable. 

@kubernetes/test-infra-maintainers @kubernetes/sig-contributor-experience-bugs

title: Add code-of-conduct-committee team
body:
I wanted to explictly at-mention the code of conduct committee in https://github.com/kubernetes/community/pull/3194 but found that there was no such team.

We already have a team for the steering committee (which is pretty useful for at-mentioning). I think it'd be useful to have this team as well.

Members of the team are the members of the CoC mentioned here: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/tree/master/committee-code-of-conduct

/cc @Bradamant3 @carolynvs @eparis @jdumars @parispittman

title: Request to create new repository kubernetes-sigs/windows-gmsa
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
new repository

### Requested name for new repository
windows-gmsa

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
@ddebroy @michmike @PatrickLang 

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
@ddebroy @michmike @PatrickLang 

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
@ddebroy @michmike @PatrickLang 

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
@ddebroy @michmike @PatrickLang 

### What should the repo description be
External components to support Windows GMSA in Kubernetes

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
This is a new subproject for sig-windows called windows-gmsa

### Approvals
Discussed the need for this repo to host GMSA related CRD and Webhooks as outlined in KEP [https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/blob/master/keps/sig-windows/20181221-windows-group-managed-service-accounts-for-container-identity.md] with SIG Windows owners @PatrickLang and @michmike in SIG Windows meeting on Tuesday Feb 5th.

### Additional context for request
This repo will need to host and build the CRD YAMLs and Webhooks associated with GMSA support in Kubernetes as detailed in KEP [https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/blob/master/keps/sig-windows/20181221-windows-group-managed-service-accounts-for-container-identity.md]

title: Transfer ownership of aws-fsx-csi-driver repository as SIG-AWS subproject
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
New repository

### Requested name for new repository
aws-fsx-csi-driver

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
@d-nishi 
@leakingtapan 
@justinsb 

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
@d-nishi 
@leakingtapan 
@justinsb
@jsafrane 

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
@d-nishi 
@leakingtapan 
@justinsb
@jsafrane 

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
@leakingtapan 

### What should the repo description be
This is the Container Storage Interface (CSI) driver implementation of Amazon FSx for Lustre that provides a CSI interface to be used by Kubernetes to manage lifecycle of Amazon FSx for lustre filesystems.

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
SIG-AWS
this will be a standalone subproject under SIG-AWS

### Approvals
Complete check-list:
* [x]  Must contain the topic for the sponsoring SIG - e.g. k8s-sig-api-machinery. (Added through the Manage topics link on the repo page.)
* [x]  Must adopt the Kubernetes Code of Conduct
* [x]  All code projects use the Apache License version 2.0. Documentation repositories must use the Creative Commons License version 4.0.
* [ ]  Must adopt the CNCF CLA bot, merge bot and Kubernetes PR commands/bots.
* [x]  All OWNERS of the project must also be active SIG members
* [x]  SIG membership must vote using lazy consensus to create a new repository
* [ ]  SIG must already have identified all of their existing subprojects and code, with valid OWNERS files, in [sigs.yaml](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/sigs.yaml)
* [x]  All contributors must have signed the CNCF Individual CLA (https://github.com/cncf/cla/blob/master/individual-cla.pdf) or CNCF Corporate CLA (https://github.com/cncf/cla/blob/master/corporate-cla.pdf)
* [x]  Licenses of dependencies are acceptable; project owners can ping [@caniszczyk](https://github.com/caniszczyk) for review of third party deps. No dependencies found.
* [x] Received lazy consensus from +8 folks in SIG-AWS meeting held on 02/08/2018: [SIG AWS Meeting minutes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1-i0xQidlXnFEP9fXHWkBxqySkXwJnrGJP9OGyP2_P14/edit#)

### Additional context for request
N.A.

title: Create kubernetes/security Github repo
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing

New Repo

### Requested name for new repository

security

### Which Organization should it reside

kubernetes

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access

* Brandon Philips (@philips)
* Jess Frazelle (@jessfraz)
* CJ Cullen (@cjcullen) 
* Tim Allclair (@tallclair)
* Jordan Liggitt (@liggitt)

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access

all admins

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS

all admins

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS

all admins

### What should the repo description be

Kubernetes Security Process and Security Committee docs

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml

This is part of the formation of the Kubernetes Product Security Committee which was approved by the Steering committee here https://github.com/kubernetes/steering/issues/89

### Approvals

Steering Committee approval for a new committee https://github.com/kubernetes/steering/issues/89

### Additional context for request

The Product Security Committee will be moving docs from SIG Release to this repo: https://github.com/kubernetes/sig-release/tree/master/security-release-process-documentation

title: Add team for kubernetes-csi.github.io
body:
Ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/org/issues/519

Currently, @lpabon has direct collaborator admin access and @saad-ali has direct collaborator write access to https://github.com/kubernetes-csi/kubernetes-csi.github.io.

This PR creates a team consisting of @lpabon and @saad-ali to provide admin access to the repo.

Once this gets merged, the postsubmit runs and the GitHub team gets created, I'll remove direct collaborator access and give the team admin access.

title: prune sig-testing teams
body:
ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/11465


These were individual commits, but probably not needed, so:

- Drop test-infra-reviewers in favor of sig-testing-pr-reviews
- Demote all sig-testing team maintainers to members
- ... except those who are GitHub Owners because GitHub, apparently
- Add akutz
- Fix Katharine's case
- Update team descriptions
- test-infra-admins ~= kubernetes/test-infra/OWNERS
- test-infra-maintainers ~= kubernetes/test-infra/OWNERS
- sig-testing-pr-reviews contains test-infra-admins

title: Add 1.14 CI Signal team as milestone maintainers
body:
All CI signal team members create issues for failing tests and flakes on the sig-release dashboards. Adding them as milestone maintainers allows them to assign the respective issues to the 1.14 release milestone, which means we can be more effective with keeping track of fixes expected to land by the release date.

cc @alejandrox1 @smourapina @mortent @kacole2

multi-tenancy

davidopp, easeway

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
davidopp, easeway

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
davidopp, easeway

### What should the repo description be
A working place for multi-tenancy related proposals and prototypes.

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
this is a new subproject for sig-auth called multi-tenancy

### Approvals

Attached the email communication:

```
On Tue, Feb 26, 2019 at 1:25 PM Tim Allclair <tallclair@google.com> wrote:
To create a new repo, file an issue here: https://github.com/kubernetes/org/issues/new?assignees=&labels=area%2Fgithub-repo&template=repo-create.md&title=

Yeah, I think we can sponsor it.

On Tue, Feb 26, 2019 at 1:21 PM David Oppenheimer <davidopp@google.com> wrote:
Hi Tim. The multitenancy working group would like to get a repo under kubernetes-sigs. Would you be willing to sponsor this for us (since the working group is part of sig-auth)? I don't know the full process for getting this approved and set up. If you (Tim) don't know, Yisui can you research this?

```

title: Request: new org teams
body:
### Organization or repository

Kubernetes org

### Users affected

Members of the `sig-docs-fr-*` aliases in [k/website/OWNERS_ALIASES](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/master/OWNERS_ALIASES#L140-L163)

### Describe the issue

Heya! 👋 Now that docs have an active French localization, we need to add two org teams for splat reviews and mentions:
- [ ] `sig-docs-fr-owners`
- [ ] `sig-docs-fr-reviews`

Team members should match their [respective aliases](https://github.com/kubernetes/website/blob/master/OWNERS_ALIASES#L140-L163) in k/website.

/area github-membership
/priority important-soon
/sig docs

title: migrate github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/k8s-container-image-promoter
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
Migrate https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/k8s-container-image-promoter

### Requested name for new repository
container-image-promoter

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
listx, dims, hh, tpepper

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
listx, dims, hh, tpepper

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
listx, dims, hh, tpepper

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
listx, dims, hh, tpepper

### What should the repo description be
A tool to promote Docker images from one registry to another.

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
This is part of the Release Engineering subproject for sig-release.

### Approvals
Please prove you have followed the appropriate approval process for this new
repo by including links to the relevant approvals (meeting minutes, e-mail
thread, etc.)
See Jan 15, 2019 meeting minutes https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Fu6HxXQu8wl6TwloGUEOXVzZ1rwZ72IAhglnaAMCPqA/edit
(Video link: https://youtu.be/Al1ClqqXyHk?t=2665)

Authoritative requirements are here: https://git.k8s.io/community/github-management/kubernetes-repositories.md

tl;dr (but really you should read the linked doc, this may be stale)
- If this is a core repository, then sig-architecture must approve
- If this is a SIG repository, then this must follow the procedure spelled out
  in that SIG's charter

### Additional context for request
Basically this tool lives in https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/k8s-container-image-promoter but it should really live inside either kubernetes or the kubernetes-sigs org.

The promoter is an implemtation component for this KEP:  https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/blob/master/keps/sig-release/k8s-image-promoter.md
Issue: https://github.com/kubernetes/k8s.io/issues/157

title: Keep getting kicked out of cri-o-maintainers list
body:
### Organization or repository
kubernetes-sigs/cri-o

### Users affected
@sboeuf

### Describe the issue
@mrunalp has been adding me as a `cri-o-maintainers`, but every time, a few hours later, I am removed from the list, with the following message sent by email:
```
You’ve been removed from the cri-o-maintainers team on the Kubernetes SIGs organization.


Cheers & Octocats,

GitHub Support
```

title: Convert GitHub team maintainers to members
body:
Now that we automate the management of GitHub teams (https://github.com/kubernetes/org/issues/336), it is confusing when people try to use GitHub's UI to manually manage teams, only to have their changes reverted (eg: https://github.com/kubernetes/org/issues/559)

While we wait for docs (https://github.com/kubernetes/community/issues/3102) I believe we should move everyone to being a regular team member, and encourage use of PR's against this repo for GitHub team management

That said, one fun little wrinkle I discovered in https://github.com/kubernetes/org/pull/522 is that GitHub Owners need to remain team maintainers

/kind cleanup
/priority important-soon

title: Revert migrate maintainers to members for kubernetes-incubator
body:
Peribolos [fails](https://prow.k8s.io/view/gcs/kubernetes-jenkins/logs/post-org-peribolos/201) with a 403 when it tries to update memberships for certain teams in kubernetes-incubator. This temporarily unblocks peribolos so other changes can be synced.


```
{"client":"github","component":"peribolos","level":"info","msg":"UpdateTeamMembership(2113629, euank, false)","time":"2019-03-11T03:17:04Z"}
{"component":"peribolos","error":"is the account using at least one of the following oauth scopes?: admin:org, repo","level":"warning","msg":"UpdateTeamMembership(2113629, euank, false) failed","time":"2019-03-11T03:17:07Z"}
{"component":"peribolos","level":"fatal","msg":"Configuration failed: failed to configure kubernetes-incubator teams: failed to update maintainers-rktlet members: 1 errors: [is the account using at least one of the following oauth scopes?: admin:org, repo]","time":"2019-03-11T03:17:07Z"}
```

The relevant diff from https://github.com/kubernetes/org/pull/566: https://github.com/kubernetes/org/pull/566/files#diff-3b95bdd66ee80ec3ebbed25503db3376

Note: I am only reverting the change for k-incubator here because teams in other orgs have been synced (some teams in kuberntes-incubator have also been synced but it should be ok to have that change reverted). I'm also not completely sure that this will fix the error, but it seems the best solution to me right now. I have created https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/pull/11720 to help debug better in the future. 

For some more context, the relevant slack discussion: https://kubernetes.slack.com/archives/C1TU9EB9S/p1552055216157000

/hold
Holding for lgtm from @spiffxp or @fejta 

/cc @spiffxp @mrbobbytables @justaugustus @rlenferink @idealhack 
/assign @spiffxp @fejta

title: Revert 'Revert migrate maintainers to members for k-incubator'
body:
Reverts #591 

#591 fixed peribolos and it's now green...but we still need to migrate maintainers to members for k-incubator.

/cc @spiffxp @mrbobbytables @justaugustus @rlenferink @idealhack 
/assign @spiffxp @fejta 
/hold

title: Migrate krew & krew-index to kubernetes-sigs
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing

Migrate two existing repositories of a project from `github.com/GoogleContainerTools` organization.

- https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/krew
- https://github.com/GoogleContainerTools/krew-index

This is a transfer of these process to the SIG CLI as subproject as agreed upon by SIG CLI leadership.

### Requested name for new repositories

1. kubernetes-sigs/**krew**
2. kubernetes-sigs/**krew-index**

### Which Organization should it reside

kubernetes-sigs

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access

- ahmetb
- juanvallejo
- soltysh
- seans3

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access

- team: sig-cli-maintainers
- ahmetb

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS

- ahmetb
- juanvallejo

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS

- ahmetb
- juanvallejo

### What should the repo description be

- For krew: `📦 Package manager for "kubectl plugins"`
- For krew-index: `Plugin index for https://github.com/kubernetes-sigs/krew. This repository is intended for plugin maintainers`

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml

This is a new subproject for sig-foo called Krew.

> TODO(@ahmetb): Update sigs.yaml

### Approvals

> Please prove you have followed the appropriate approval process for this new
repo by including links to the relevant approvals (meeting minutes, e-mail
thread, etc.)

- Approval from [SIG CLI meeting minutes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1r0YElcXt6G5mOWxwZiXgGu_X6he3F--wKwg-9UBc29I/edit#heading=h.himo1st0tqyy) from March 13, 2019:

    > Announcements: SIG-CLI will be adopting krew plugin manager. Will be adopted under the “kubernetes-sigs” repo.

- [Discussion on SIG Architecture/CLI/Apps mailing lists](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kubernetes-sig-cli/9fWm_aZ-AC8/RkFUFR_JBQAJ) recommending SIG CLI should make the decision

### Additional context for request

**Question about sigs.yaml:** I am not sure if sigs.yaml must be updated first or this request should be processed first.

**Question about CLAs:** We've been using Google CLA for all previous contributions to these repositories. Would this pose a problem?

**Question about copyright statements:** Currently source code license headers read "Copyright [YYYY] Google, Inc". Could/should this be changed or retained for a proper transfer?

**Question about third-party dependencies:** Just like any other Go project, there are some 3rd party dependencies of this project. cc'ing @caniszczyk per [this doc](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/github-management/kubernetes-repositories.md#sig-repositories).

**Transfer logistics** I will be coordinating transfer of repos from github.com/GoogleContainerTools side once the issue is approved. dlorenc (cc'ed below) is the owner of the source org.

/cc @soltysh @seans3 @pwittrock @juanvallejo @dlorenc

title: Add milestone team, clean up teams in general
body:
For https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/11687#issuecomment-474388190.

This PR specifies who can use `/milestone` in the website repo. 

Membership in this team requires an entry in a `sig-docs-**-owners` alias for a localization project in k/website. (See https://github.com/kubernetes/website/pull/13287) Note that `website-milestone-maintainers` imports membership by reference to language owner groups.

This PR also updates sig-docs team membership based on `k/website/OWNERS_ALIASES`.

title: add neolit123 to kubernetes-milestone-maintainers
body:
we had a discussion today about this in the kubeadm office hours meeting and i got approval from a SIG chair (@timothysc) and a tech lead (@fabriziopandini).

i have read the details about the milestone maintainers role:
https://github.com/kubernetes/sig-release/blob/master/release-team/README.md#milestone-maintainers

this is a primary "super power" i'm interested in, because our k/e items descriptions need update:
> Milestone maintainers also have write access to kubernetes/enhancements, which allows them to keep enhancement tracking issue descriptions up-to-date.

---

> for SIGs: Request approval from a SIG Chair or Technical Lead

/assign @timothysc @fabriziopandini 

> Once your request is approved by the appropriate group, you can now assign to the PR to a SIG Release Chair for final approval.

/assign @tpepper @justaugustus

title: Steering Committee has approval rights on SIG team membership
body:
### Organization or repository
kubernetes/org

### Users affected
All (@kubernetes/owners)

### Describe the issue
While looking at https://github.com/kubernetes/org/pull/636, I noticed that the PR was already approved and merged, but by a non-SIG Release Chair/Lead.

I retroactively approved the PR, to make it clear that we're fine with the change, but I'd like to discuss a little. @timothysc was able to approve as he's part of Steering, which is listed as a root approver for k/org. I already chatted with Tim offline, and he said to definitely file an issue for this.

Do we want this? 
As SIGs should be responsible for organizing themselves and Steering is really supposed to be an approver/denier of last resort, I think that we should either:
- Remove Steering as a [root approver for k/org](https://github.com/kubernetes/org/blob/master/OWNERS#L17).
- Set `no_parent_owners: true` in SIG OWNERS files

title: New kubernetes/cri-api github repository for staging the CRI API
body:
### New Repo, Staging Repo, or migrate existing
We need a new kubernetes/cri-api (similar to kubernetes/csi-api or kubernetes/node-api)

### Requested name for new repository
cri-api

### Which Organization should it reside
kubernetes

### If not a staging repo, who should have admin access
it is a staging repo.

### If not a staging repo, who should have write access
it is a staging repo.

### If a new repo, who should be listed as approvers in OWNERS
@dchen1107 @derekwaynecarr @dims 

### If a new repo, who should be listed in SECURITY_CONTACTS
@dchen1107 @derekwaynecarr @dims 

### What should the repo description be
`Container Runtime Interface (CRI) – a plugin interface which enables kubelet to use a wide variety of container runtimes`

### What SIG and subproject does this fall under in sigs.yaml
sig-node

### Approvals
Please prove you have followed the appropriate approval process for this new
repo by including links to the relevant approvals (meeting minutes, e-mail
thread, etc.)

- Approval from SIG-node : https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kubernetes-sig-node/1YDal_Pwq6k/ie3jVtstAwAJ
- Part of larger work separating CRI/dockershim from k/k : https://groups.google.com/d/msg/kubernetes-sig-architecture/UjeVR1N3yTo/RH4g3MZIAgAJ

### Additional context for request
closely related to the KEP being filed for dockershim : https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/pull/866

title: Add milestone team for SIG Docs
body:
For https://github.com/kubernetes/test-infra/issues/11687#issuecomment-474388190.

This PR specifies who can use `/milestone` in the website repo. Membership in the team milestone requires an entry in a sig-docs-**-owners alias for a localization project in k/website. (See kubernetes/website#13287)

Reboot of https://github.com/kubernetes/org/pull/628#issuecomment-475772806 for clean commit history.

/sig docs
/assign @nikhita 


This PR also updates sig-docs team membership based on `k/website/OWNERS_ALIASES`.

New Repo

netlify-test

@kubernetes-sigs

@mrbobbytables

@mrbobbytables

@mrbobbytables

Temporary repo to test netlify integration

- [x] I have spoken to my sponsors ahead of this application, and they have agreed to sponsor my application

### Sponsors
- @brancz 
- @DirectXMan12 

### List of contributions to the Kubernetes project
* Created and contributed the current underlying minikube Linux distribution, replacing boot2docker:
  * https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/commits?author=sur%40coreos.com
* Contributed to the Kubernetes Mesos scheduler:
  * https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/commits?author=sur%40mesosphere.io

Although not part of the Kubernetes org, I am now actively maintaining k8s-prometheus-adapter: https://github.com/DirectXMan12/k8s-prometheus-adapter.

Additionally I am looking forward to take ownership of the API server machinery for the Kubernetes metrics APIs: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/76110#issuecomment-479779672

title: Add team for dep-approvers
body:
OWNERS files don't support regex right now, which means we can't require dep-approvers to be able to approve `go.mod` and `go.sum` changes. Ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/76167

Add a team for it so that it's easier to cc them for a review, before cc'ing a root approver.

Ref: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/06150f798e271ec048cd03fef98908b7a23c4486/OWNERS_ALIASES#L290-L297

/cc @cblecker @liggitt @sttts @BenTheElder @dims

title: Remove quinton-hoole-2, keep quinton-hoole
body:
https://github.com/quinton-hoole-2 no longer exists, @quinton-hoole is the real one now :)

This should make peribolos green.
